title: What are the best books about industry analysis? - Quora

response.answer_text: I recommend starting with Microeconomics. If you read the book “Industry Organisation” by Jean Tirole, you will look at industry analysis in a different way. Basically, the book will teach you about how companies in different industries compete with each other. One of the key insights that is very applicable to real life is about two-sided markets. Two-sided markets explain how Google, Facebook, and eBay do businesses. It also shed light on how they compete with each other. Follow me for more answers on investing and economics.

I find that many of the best books don't actually set out to describe "how to do industry analysis", but are nevertheless most useful for providing a guide for how to understand the dynamics of industries. See, for example: Michael Porter, Competitive StrategyClayton Christensen, The Innovator's Dilemma Richard Rumelt, Good Strategy, Bad Strategy
